questions.title: The Enlightenment! (Topic 5.1)
questions.description: The Enlightenment provides context for the rest of the unit. The "Enlightenment" describes an era known for science & new ideas about politics, culture, economics, & society.

questions.question: Most philosophers of the Enlightenment supported

choices.answer: Ancient and medieval traditional solutions.
Using human reason & logic to create solutions.
The divine right of Kings to force solutions.
Turning to the Bible for religious solutions.

questions.question: Who would have REJECTED Enlightenment ideas because it challenged divine right?

choices.answer: John Locke
Immanuel Kant
Mary Wollstonecraft
King Louis XIV of France

questions.question: This quote is an argument for...

choices.answer: revolutions against the power of Kings.
voting rights for all people.
the divine right of Kings to rule.
the Protestant Reformation against Catholicism.

questions.question: What were "salons" during the Enlightenment?

choices.answer: They were book publishers with printing presses.
They were places to meet for religious ceremony.
They were places for philosophers to share ideas.
They were businesses that ran printing presses.

questions.question: This quote is an argument for which of the following belief systems that developed between 1750 to 1900?

choices.answer: Abolitionism
Socialism
Capitalism
Feminism

questions.question: All of these are true about the Enlightenment era EXCEPT

choices.answer: Philosophers advocated using reason & logic to guide human action.
Revolutionaries relied on "liberal" ideas to legitimize their revolts.
Enlightenment ideas influenced abolitionism and feminism.
Traditional political & religious authority was accepted without question.

questions.question: Poll: Favorite human rights movement that emerged from the Enlightenment? Go!

choices.answer: Revolutions based on popular sovereignty (Republics) vs. divine right Kings
Movements to abolish the Atlantic slave trade & slavery (Abolitionism)
End of the Medieval practice of Feudal serfdom
The push for women's equality & suffrage (Feminism)

questions.title: Nationalism and Revolutions! (Topic 5.2)
questions.description: Historical developments of this topic are "nationalism" as a new form of human identity and the causes/effects of the various "Atlantic Revolutions" which occurred throughout the world in this period.

questions.question: Discontent with the divine power of kings encouraged the development of new governments. This describes a

choices.answer: political cause of revolution
social cause of revolution
economic cause of revolution
religious cause of revolution

questions.question: Which of the following was an ECONOMIC cause of the Atlantic Revolutions?

choices.answer: Popular sovereignty was becoming more widely accepted.
Nationalistic feelings of a shared identity were spreading.
European Kings were gradually increasing taxes.
Demands for women's suffrage were growing

questions.question: Great Britain's mercantilist policies, rising taxes, and tightening political control were causes of

choices.answer: The Haitian Revolution
The American Revolution
The Latin American Revolutions
The French Revolution

questions.question: A widespread crop failure, rising taxes, Louis XVI's weak leadership, and a growing middle class all contributed to

choices.answer: The Haitian Revolution
The American Revolution
The Latin American Revolutions
The French Revolution

questions.question: Successful "maroon communities" and growing unrest in the empire of France caused Toussaint L'Ouverture to start...

choices.answer: The Haitian Revolution
The American Revolution
The Latin American Revolutions
The French Revolution

questions.question: Napoleon's invasion of Spain and Portugal weakened their power over their empire, so "Creoles" like Bolivar began

choices.answer: The Haitian Revolution
The American Revolution
The Latin American Revolutions
The French Revolution

questions.question: How were all of these Atlantic Revolutions similar?

choices.answer: They all led to the abolition of slavery.
They all were politically inspired by Enlightenment ideas.
They all led to widespread tolerance of different cultures.
They all created a desire to create imperial nations.

questions.question: Definition: "The authority to govern derives from the people rather than from God" = which vocab term?

choices.answer: popular sovereignty
divine right
nationalism
feminism

questions.question: Which of the following is an accurate description of the outcome of the American Revolution?

choices.answer: A new government and nation-state was created.
Colonial elites lost their power to the victorious British.
A socialist government was created which guaranteed economic equality.
Slaves were freed and women gained voting rights.

questions.question: The French Revolution was DIFFERENT from the American revolution because

choices.answer: it was the only revolution to draw on Enlightenment ideas
it sought to recreate a new French society from scratch
it wanted to preserve existing liberties in France
it had no participation by women in revolutionary actions

questions.question: Why was the guillotine such a CUTTING EDGE technology? Because it was AHEAD of its time. DOUBLE Dad joke! Boom!

choices.answer: Funniest joke ever.
Oh ha!
Why tho?
Stop just stop.

questions.question: All of the following were causes of the Haitian Revolution EXCEPT

choices.answer: The growing nationalism at slave voodoo ceremonies.
The brutality of sugar plantation owners
The weakening control of France after their revolution
Slave owners desired to immediately free their slaves

questions.question: What made the Haitian Revolution DIFFERENT from the other Atlantic Revolutions?

choices.answer: It was the only revolution that had economic effects.
It was the only revolution that led to a newly independent nation state.
It was the first, and only, successful slave revolution.
It was the only revolution inspired by liberal Enlightenment ideas.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the long term effect of the Haitian Revolution?

choices.answer: Enlightenment ideas spread in Europe
It inspired other Latin American revolutions
It led to the immediate end of the Atlantic slave trade
Racism and inequality between whites and blacks in the Americas disappeared

questions.question: Read the following Document. What is the best statement of context for this document?

choices.answer: As a 'Creole', Bolivar wanted rule by 'Peninsulares' to continue.
Bolivar was allied with Native Americans and wanted to give them land.
The USA and Haiti inspired Bolivar to believe in political revolution.
Bolivar wanted to abolish all social class distinctions.

questions.question: Latin American Revolutions happened because their revolutionaries REJECTED the idea that

choices.answer: nations should have power over their own affairs.
republics should give popular sovereignty (power) to people.
men should retain almost all political and social power.
it was acceptable for European Kings to rule "Americanos".

questions.question: What is an accurate summary of Bolivar's justification for revolution in this document?

choices.answer: Environmental-He wanted to reverse the effects of the Columbian Exchange
Political-He is arguing for the right of land owners to vote.
Economic-He is against Spanish mercantilism & European imperialism.
Social-He is advocating equality for Latinas & smashing male patriarchy.

questions.question: The ideas of this document are best understood in the context of which of the following ideological philosophies?

choices.answer: Nationalism
Feminism
Capitalism
Socialism

questions.question: Some historians argue that feminism has come in 'waves'. In this view, "First Wave" feminism between 1750-1900 was

choices.answer: mostly about women's suffrage-POLITICS
mostly about women's pay equality-ECONOMICS
mostly about women's marital and sexual rights-SOCIETY
mostly about challenging systems of women's inequality-ALL THEMES

questions.question: In this document, what ideology is being used to critique and solve the issue of male patriarchy?

choices.answer: The author uses a critique of NATIONALISM to solve patriarchy.
The author uses Enlightenment LIBERALISM to critique & solve patriarchy.
The author uses CAPITALISM to critique and solve patriarchy.
The author uses a Marxist COMMUNISM critique of patriarchy.

questions.question: What MOST motivated those who "challenged boundaries to unify separate regions based on shared identity"? (ex: Germany)

choices.answer: Deism
Nationalism
Feminism
Socialism

questions.title: The Industrial Revolution! (Topics 5.3-5.9)
questions.description: Arguably the 2nd most important historical development, Industrial Revolution topics include how it started, its spread, inventions, government/economy, and the effects & reactions to the changes wrought by the era.

questions.question: So, "why Europe?" asks Professor Strayer. The next picture would BEST provide evidence to support an argument that

choices.answer: The divine right of Kings to tax provided capital to support industry.
Europe had access to multiple pre-industrial resources such as coal & iron.
Rulers supported & rewarded basic S.T.E.M. research that led to inventions.
Joint stock companies created a capitalist class to support innovation.

questions.question: Some historians argue Europe's acceptance of Adam Smith's ideas caused industrialization. This is a ______ argument.

choices.answer: Capitalist
Nationalist
Socialist
Feminist

questions.question: While all these caused British industrialization, which IS NOT shown on these two change over time maps?

choices.answer: An abundance of coal and iron
Many rivers and sea ports for trade
A growing urbanized labor force
Capitalist legal protection of private property rights

questions.question: This painting best illustrates which of the following economic transformations after c. 1750 C.E.?

choices.answer: The transition from medieval guilds to cottage industry of home production
The transition from human/animal power to a fossil fuel economy
The transition from the 1st to 2nd Industrial Revolution
The transition from an industrial to a postindustrial knowledge economy

questions.question: The steam engine MOST used which type of fuel source for power?

choices.answer: wood
coal
oil
nuclear

questions.question: Using this map, after starting in Great Britain, which nations of Europe industrialized THE MOST?

choices.answer: Spain and Portugal
Italy and Greece
The Russian and Ottoman Empires
France and Germany

questions.question: The internal combustion engine MOST used which type of fuel source for power?

choices.answer: wood
coal
oil
nuclear

questions.question: Which of the following statements could BEST be proven by the evidence in the chart?

choices.answer: Industry caused environmental damage
All regional economies changed because of industry
Social living standards improved over time for all
East Asia continued its dominance over time

questions.question: Which nation was most responsible for the inventions you see in this slide?

choices.answer: Great Britain
Russia
France
The United States of America

questions.question: How closely were you paying attention? Which inventions are most associated with the 2ND Industrial Revolution?

choices.answer: steam engine, coal, railroads
internal combustion engine, oil, automobiles
diesel engine, refined petroleums, plastics
electric engines, solar power, the internet

questions.question: Which continent saw a relative DECLINE in economic output because they weren't industrializing?

choices.answer: Europe
North America
Asia
Africa

questions.question: Which historical process was MOST responsible for the demographic change after 1700?

choices.answer: Agricultural & energy innovations of the Industrial Rev.
Atlantic Revolutions resulting in new popular sovereignty.
Migration of labor from Europe and Asia to new colonies.
The imperial conquests by Europeans, the USA, and Japan.

questions.question: This graph provides evidence for which of the following claims?

choices.answer: Population growth & urbanization grew most after the Neolithic Revolution.
Population growth & urbanization grew most after Medieval climate changes.
Population growth & urbanization grew most after the Columbian Exchange.
Population growth & urbanization grew exponentially after industrialization

questions.question: Rapid urbanization resulted in many problems. In your opinion, which was the WORST?

choices.answer: Air Pollution
Poverty & slum conditions
Increased crime
Public health crises

questions.question: Examine this document. Which person would have MOST agreed with the author's POV?

choices.answer: An aristocratic Lord of England
A workingman in a factory
A middle class consumer
A communist revolutionary

questions.question: Look at what happened in the year 1900. According to capitalist theory, what SHOULD have happened to prices of goods?

choices.answer: The prices people pay for goods should have stayed the same.
The prices people pay for goods should have increased.
The prices people pay for goods should have gone down.

questions.question: The "ideology of domesticity" encouraged middle class women to

choices.answer: shop, take care of the kids & home, give charity, & get a hobby.
move out of cities and return to a simpler way of life on a farm.
become labor union organizers to advocate for factory reforms.
sell stuff to their friends on Facebook and become Instagram influencers.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The Factory System, by combining human & machine labor, __________ "specialization of labor".

choices.answer: had no effect on
decreased
increased

questions.question: Which document would help you most to understand these girl's working conditions?

choices.answer: The tax records of the factory owner
A catalog of advertisements for clothing
A city map of railroads from their homes to the factory
A company manual listing pay rates for hours worked

questions.question: This image could BEST be used to provide evidence that

choices.answer: Men were more likely to be managers & skilled labor than women & children.
The working class and bourgeois families both had similar jobs.
Working class neighborhoods were unsanitary and dangerous.
Factory owners paid workers well and didn't make them work long hours.

questions.question: The publication of factory photos like this one gave evidence & support for reformers who argued that

choices.answer: electricity should replace coal as the basis of a new economy.
fossil fuels should be eliminated because of their pollution effects.
governments shouldn't interfere with the property rights of capitalists.
negative social and safety effects of industry should  be regulated.

questions.question: Workers organized LABOR UNIONS. They demanded, and often went on strike, to get all of the following EXCEPT:

choices.answer: Limited working hours: the 8 hour workday
Higher wages: the minimum wage
A reduction of taxes on corporate profits
Work conditions: more safety on the job

questions.question: This quote was written by a man who advocated which type of response to industrialization?

choices.answer: Capitalist protection of private property rights
Imperial mercantilist control of resources and trade
Democratic liberal voting rights for the majority
Communist control of the economy with the goal of Socialism

questions.question: According to this Marxist view, what SHOULD have inevitably happened as a result of industrial class conflict?

choices.answer: The proletariat would revolt and abolish social classes.
The bourgeoisie would win because they had more money.
Capitalist governments would regulate industry & markets to reduce conflict
A dictator would emerge who could enforce absolute obedience to the state.

questions.question: What does Strayer argue was a development which limited the appeal of communism & socialism?

choices.answer: The violence unleashed by anarchist radicals.
The rise of the middle class who enjoyed material benefits.
Wealthy elites who bribed the working class with charity.
New laws that regulated income distribution.

questions.question: Which of the following migrations DID NOT happen during the time period of the map?

choices.answer: England established settler colonies in Australia
The USA drew large numbers of workers from Europe
Spanish Peninsulares went to the Americas to rule
Many ex-serfs in Russia migrated to Northern Asia

questions.question: Which of the following technologies would have been LEAST used during this time period to migrate?

choices.answer: Railroads
Steamships
Airplanes
Telegraphs

questions.question: Which of the following is the best explanation for the PULL factors that drew so many Europeans to migrate?

choices.answer: Industrial demand for labor & the availability of land to settle.
Successful communist revolutions created socialist utopias
The abolition of slavery created a huge demand for more laborers
Migrants were assured that they would be treated with equality & respect

questions.question: What do you call an industrial revolution joke that's not great, not good, not bad, it's just...ok? It's satisFACTORY!

choices.answer: Funniest joke ever.
Oh ha!
Why tho?
Stop just stop.
